slides.title: Working Remotely: Setting Yourself Up for Success
slides.content: Remote work offers flexibility and autonomy, but also requires intentional practices to maintain productivity, wellbeing, and connection with your team. This course will introduce key strategies for remote work success.

slides.title: Creating an Effective Workspace
slides.alt: Well-organized home office with proper ergonomic setup, natural light, and minimal distractions
slides.text: Your workspace significantly impacts your productivity and health. Aim for good ergonomics, natural light, and minimal distractions. Separate your work area from relaxation spaces when possible to maintain work-life boundaries.

slides.title: Home Office Ergonomics
slides.description: Quick tips for setting up an ergonomic home workspace

slides.title: Establishing Boundaries and Routines
slides.content: Without the structure of an office environment, creating personal routines becomes essential. Clear boundaries between work and personal life help prevent burnout and maintain focus.

slides.title: Work-Life Balance
slides.alt: Illustration showing clear separation between work activities and personal life, with a person closing laptop at end of workday
slides.caption: Maintaining boundaries helps prevent work from consuming your personal time

slides.title: Routine Best Practices
items: Take regular breaks (try the Pomodoro Technique)
Create morning and evening rituals to 'start' and 'end' work
Use 'do not disturb' settings during focus time
Communicate your availability to colleagues and household members

slides.title: Digital Communication Excellence
slides.alt: Person effectively using multiple digital communication tools with organized interface and clear messaging
slides.text: Clear communication becomes even more critical in remote settings. Be intentional about your communication style, choose the right tools for different messages, and practice overcommunication to ensure alignment.

slides.title: Communication Tools & When to Use Them
items: Email: Formal communications, external contacts, documentation
Chat (Slack/Teams): Quick questions, informal updates, team banter
Video calls: Complex discussions, relationship building, brainstorming
Project management tools: Task tracking, dependencies, deadlines

slides.title: Effective Virtual Meetings
slides.description: Tips for productive and engaging virtual meetings

slides.title: Building Remote Relationships
slides.alt: Diverse team members connecting virtually with casual conversation and team activities on screen
slides.text: Remote work can feel isolating without intentional connection. Make time for casual conversations, virtual team activities, and one-on-one check-ins to build relationships beyond just work tasks.

slides.title: The Human Element
slides.content: The biggest challenge of working from home isn't proving you're workingâ€”it's building and maintaining relationships when you aren't in the same physical space.
slides.author: Darren Murph, Head of Remote at GitLab

slides.title: Building Remote Connections
items: Create dedicated channels for non-work conversations
Be present and engaged during video meetings

slides.title: Wellbeing and Self-Care
slides.alt: Person taking a mindful break from computer, stretching, with healthy snack and water nearby
slides.caption: Regular self-care is essential for sustainable remote work

slides.title: Preventing Burnout
slides.content: Remote workers often struggle with disconnecting and may work longer hours than office-based colleagues. Be proactive about your wellbeing by scheduling breaks, movement, and truly disconnecting after hours. Remember that consistency and sustainability are more important than occasional bursts of productivity.

questions.question: Which of the following is most important when setting up a home workspace?
options: Having the latest technology
Creating an ergonomic setup that prevents physical strain
Making it look impressive for video calls
Being close to your kitchen
questions.correct: Creating an ergonomic setup that prevents physical strain

questions.question: What is the Pomodoro Technique mentioned in the course?
options: A way to organize your email inbox
A video conferencing platform
A time management method using focused work periods followed by short breaks
A team-building exercise for remote teams
questions.correct: A time management method using focused work periods followed by short breaks

questions.question: Which communication tool is best for complex discussions and relationship building?
options: Email
Chat applications
Video calls
Project management tools

questions.question: What is one effective way to establish boundaries between work and personal life?
options: Always being available to respond to messages
Working from your bed or couch
Creating consistent start and end rituals for your workday
Mixing household chores with work tasks throughout the day
questions.correct: Creating consistent start and end rituals for your workday

questions.question: According to the course, why is it important to schedule casual interactions with colleagues?
options: To ensure everyone is working their required hours
To monitor team productivity
To build relationships and combat isolation
To replace formal meetings
questions.correct: To build relationships and combat isolation
